pageContext.claim: “This was our [initial] prediction that if we do a really good job, we'll be at about a hundred and -- 100,000 to 240,000 deaths. And we're below that substantially.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump had many predictions and kept low-balling the numbers. At the time, the death toll was 197,000 but within weeks it exceeded 240,000. After the election, it exceeded 300,000.
